ImageFunction.colorRect

Function/Meaning
Rectangular translucent fill
Type
Method of ImageFunction class
Syntax
colorRect(bmp, value, opa=255, rect=null, face=dfAlpha, cliprect=null)
Arguments
bmp Specifies the Bitmap object to be filled.
value Specifies the color or value to fill with.
The meaning of this value changes depending on the face argument.
dfAlpha : Specify the color in 0xRRGGBB format
dfAddAlpha : Specify the color in 0xRRGGBB format
dfOpaque : Specify the color in 0xRRGGBB format
dfMask : Specify the mask (opacity) value ( 0 to 255 )
If dfOpaque is specified, mask information is ignored. Also, if dfMask is specified, color information remains unchanged.
In the case of dfAlpha, if opa is negative, this argument is ignored.
opa Specifies the opacity to fill with ( -255 to 0 to 255 ).
This argument is ignored if the face value is dfMask or dfProvince (always fully opaque).
Specifying a negative number is valid only when face is dfAlpha; in this case, the value argument is ignored, and opacity is removed from the image (specifying -255 makes the rectangle completely transparent).
rect Specifies the rectangle to be filled as a Rect object in pixels (relative to the image position).
If unspecified, the entire area is targeted.
face Specifies the drawing method.
If dfAlpha is specified, the image is treated as an image with an alpha channel and drawn.
If dfAddAlpha is specified, the image is treated as an image with an additive alpha channel and drawn.
If dfOpaque is specified, the image is treated as fully opaque and drawn.
cliprect Specifies the clipping region as a Rect object (relative to the Bitmap's image position).
If unspecified, the entire area is targeted.
Return Value
None (void)
Description
Fills the rectangle of the specified Bitmap image using the specified method.
Unlike ImageFunction.fillRect, you can specify the opacity and fill with translucency.
